layer.name: Order
layer.definition: Reality has patterns that can be discovered and used.

answers.4: mostly — reality follows patterns we can discover
answers.5: absolutely — the universe is deeply structured and knowable
answers.2: possibly — but we can only scratch the surface
answers.3: partly — some things can be understood, others can't
answers.1: not really — things are fundamentally chaotic

questions.text: Knowledge is possible because there are patterns waiting to be discovered ...

answers.4: generally — patterns exist across most of reality
answers.5: certainly — order in reality makes knowledge possible
answers.2: possibly — but how would we know for sure?
answers.3: in some domains — science works, other areas are murky
answers.1: I'm skeptical — maybe knowledge is illusion

questions.text: The success of science, mathematics, and logic in describing reality suggests ...

answers.4: significant order — these tools work because reality cooperates
answers.5: deep order — reality is structured to be understood
answers.2: maybe some order — but we could be missing the chaos underneath
answers.3: partial order — some domains are orderly, others aren't
answers.1: nothing certain — they're just useful models

questions.text: The idea that reality is fundamentally chaotic or unknowable is ...

answers.4: mostly wrong — reality has deep structure
answers.5: completely wrong — order is fundamental to existence
answers.3: partly true — some things will never be known
answers.1: probably true — we're just pattern-seeking animals

questions.text: Clear thinking is possible because reality itself has structure ...

answers.4: generally — thinking can match reality's structure
answers.5: absolutely — our minds can grasp reality because both are ordered
answers.2: possibly — but it's hard to know if we're getting it right
answers.3: sometimes — in some areas clarity is possible
answers.1: I'm not sure thinking is ever truly clear
